title: Firmware Development Lifecycle
text:
Requirements -> Test Specs -> Firmware Development
Test Driven Development (TDD) for firmware

Continuous Integration (CI) setup from start
Everything hosted on a Git repository of your choice.
CI on development machine with Jenkins based CI
Remote CI based on Azure, GitHub or Atlassian1
Integration testing with Python based automated testing
Hardware-in-loop (HIL) implemented when needed
CppUTest unit testing framework

Experience and tooling available for following
For simpler applications: Microchip PIC24, AVR microcontrollers
For larger and higher speed: ST Micro Cortex-M STM32 or Microchip dsPIC




















Requirements document
Test reports
Delivery of reproducible development environment
Tech-transfer; no holding out on knowledge

title: Firmware Development Lifecycle
text:
Footnotes


Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions and Atlassian Bitbucket is free for 5 users, needs subscription if more.‚Ü©Ô∏é

title: Electronics and Optics Hardware Development Lifecycle
text:
Requirements -> Test Specs -> Hardware Development
Hardware Development

Modularisation into testable entities
Rapid design iteration for early prototypes

Schematics, module PCBs

Characterisation and testing
Integration of modules to complete system

Integrated PCB with annotated schematics

Acceptance Testing
Design optimisation and pre-production.

Release PCB









Test Driven Development for hardware

Continuous Integration (CI) setup from start
Everything hosted on a Git repository of your choice.
CI on the development machine with test harnesses
Integration testing with Python based automated testing
Hardware-in-loop (HIL) implemented when needed

Efficient hardware design in KiCAD1 or Eagle CAD (Autodesk)

up to 4 layers electronics PCB

Quick turn-around for urgent electronic prototypes by experienced hand assembly

Suited for up to 50 surface mount and 20 through-hole components

All boards manufactured in Europe

Preferred suppliers:

Beta-Layout,
Aisler.net











Requirements and Testing Documents
Delivery of reproducible testing environment
Tech-transfer; no holding out on knowledge
Bill-of-materials (BOM)
CAD output for records





Digikey, Farnell, RS Components or Mouser
Hamamatsu for higher spec photonic components (photodiodes and arrays)
Comar Optics, Edmund Optics, Thorlabs for Opto-Mechanical Components

PCBs Sourced from UK/Europe only Up to 3 PCBs can be hand-assembled for rapid-turnaround Small batch can be ordered by machine assembly with turn-around time of 3 weeks

title: About
text:
üëØ Leading early phases of product development with complex multidisciplinary integration.
Realistic and informed solutions for technical and related business problems.
Designing data-flow driven and test-driven instruments software and hardware architecture.
Risk-based rapid design iterations to reach informed and well tested design decisions.
Focussing on deliverable and demo-worthy outcomes.
Customer centric and requirements driven R&D.
Working with design, marketing and executive teams







Leading a multi-talented team for product development.
Leading R&D and IP development from ground-up.




I have demonstrated these skills in real-world projects.

Python for R&D (NumPy, Matplotlib, Jupyter Notebook, Pandas)
Python for Firmware Development and Testing
Deep Learning with Convolutional Neural Networks with TensorFlow and Scikit-Learn
Image Processing with OpenCV and Scikit-Image
Embedded C/C++ (AVR, PIC24, ARM Cortex-M)
Proof-of-concept Android + Kotlin App development for Computer Vision and Bluetooth.

I have been able to support / debug / add features to following platforms:

C#/.NET Forms and WPF Apps





Precise and data-driven reporting.
Direct reporting to CEO and Chairman
Design, development and delivery of in-vitro diagnostics (IVD) products
Software development compliant to ISO 62304:2016 Medical Device Lifecyle (Class A,B)
Technical project management and work-package leadership.





Realistic product delivery schedules - there is a difference between ambitious and unrealistic.
Value driven culture -
Flat or shallow hierachical strcutures.







Fluorescence detection-based point-of-care diagnostics platforms : bridging the gap between laboratory and market.
Doctoral Thesis, 2014, University of Basel, Faculty of Science.



Isotropic colour effects based on diffraction gratings for document security.
Master Thesis, 2009.

title: 125systems
text:
Hi, I am Neeraj Adsul. With over 12 years of experience in R&D, I excel in innovatively integrating software-hardware solutions to address real-world challenges. My expertise lies in medtech-sensor systems, optics-electronics design, and seamless integration of hybrid technologies into product development. I am known for my dedication, diligence, and commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Proficient in embedded C/Rust, Python ecosystem, and data-driven software, I have a solid track record in designing and developing cutting-edge products, including point-of-care IVD instruments, smartphone-based lateral-flow readers, and opto-electronic embedded systems integration. My strength lies in thriving in multi-disciplinary environments, collaborating effectively with diverse teams to achieve project success.

title: Docker Cheatsheet / Notes
text:
Docker Run in Details

Interactive mode
docker run -it interactive mode with psuedo terminal


port mapping
docker run -p <host_port>:<con_port> maps host port to container port


volume mapping, data persistence
docker run -v <host_vol>:<con_vol> maps host storage to container storage
e.g. docker run -it /home/neeraj/Sources:/home/ alpine:3.17

title: Docker Cheatsheet / Notes
text:
Supplementary
docker logs <con_id> view the logs
docker attach  <con_id> attaches to given running container
docker inspect <con_id> displays information about running container, e.g.¬†ip address

title: Docker Cheatsheet / Notes
text:
Docker Images and Containerization

How to create the image?

start with the OS
FROM python:3.11.0-alpine


Docker Environment Variables
docker run -e APP_VARIANT=12


Docker Compose
Running multi-container app

title: Product Development with Realistic V-model
text:
The V-Model process for new product development is a structured approach to product development that emphasizes testing and verification throughout the entire process. However, the traditional model is almost a waterfall type model which fails to match the pratice.




The product development process starts with requirements analysis. In this phase, the product requirements are collected and analyzed to ensure they are complete, consistent, and achievable.




The system design phase involves creating a high-level design of the product. This includes defining the system architecture and subsystems, and identifying interfaces and communication protocols.


The system is brocken down in modules is designed in detail. This includes defining the interfaces between modules, and creating detailed design specifications.




The implementation phase involves building and integrating the subsystems into a complete system. This phase includes coding, unit testing, and integration testing.



The testing phase involves testing the product against software and hardware requirements specifications to ensure that it meets the design specifications. This includes functional testing, performance testing,



This testing is primarily focussing one the user acceptance testing in as close as possible to the real-world testing environement. The user could be an instrument, another software or a web API.



In the validation phase, the product is validated against the user requirements to ensure that it meets their needs. This may include usability testing, security testing, and regulatory compliance testing.
By following this improved V-Model process for new product development, companies can ensure that their products are thoroughly tested and validated before they are released to market.

title: Value Oriented Data Science
text:
During early years of am immunoassay based company significant amount of data is generated. Typically, such a data is managed with traditional spreadsheet/csv files based systems which are used to create reports or presentations on need basis. However, over period of years it is hard to make sense of all of the data at once.
There are several products in the market which provide data management and dashboarding. However they are targeted towards larger enterprises. Furthermore they are simply unaffordable and overkill for early phases.
Therefore a simpler, custom developed system is an optimal solution. The system uses the sofware ecosystem which is extensively used by scientific communities as well as indutries across the world. The tools inlcude:

Python + NumPy + Matplotlib
Pandas + Jupyter Lab Notebooks




Development of data solution
Setup in internal network environment
Delivery of reproducible environment
Tech-transfer; no holding out on knowledge





Training of relevant staff.
Setup in a private web-hosted environment (virtual server).
